file_content.text: Cleanup time. Collect the devices, contain the intel.
Congratulations. I've never seen such a smooth resolution for such a bad situation.
Reinforcements are getting in position now--the teleporter control hub is ours. No more Esh-kha escapees terrorizing the galaxy. Perfect.
The Esh-kha had to be stopped. I just did my part.
It was nothing.
Still, we couldn't have managed it without you.
Easy as could be.
Whatever you say.
Let's talk about my payment.
You'll get your due.
Now, do I need to remind you that this entire situation is classified? Never tell anyone what happened here. Clear?
People will rest easier if they never have to know about dangers like the Esh-kha.
That seems wise.
We need to fully understand what we're dealing with before revealing it to the galaxy at large.
Some knowledge must be hidden.
We wouldn't want the enemy finding out how much we've learned here.
Understood.
Agreed.
Breathe easy. Discretion is how I earn my living.
Don't worry about it.
Good.
I'd better get on with the cleanup operations. Thanks again for your assistance.
Yeah, yeah, fine.
This is serious.
I'm not one of your agents. I don't have to keep your secrets.
Don't tell me what to do.
We're at war, and the Imps aren't the only ones who would kill to get their hands on what we've found. If word gets out, people will die.
Now, get on with your own business. And try not to undo everything we've just accomplished.
Time's against us. You need to get moving.
Confirmed. It's them.
Confirmed. This is the one.
Agent Moritt--SIS. Don't mind the scanners, just routine.
You've seen the old tech down on the prison's lower levels--even cut down more than your share of these "Esh-kha." That right, Master Jedi?
Some foes leave you with no other choice.
When I had to.
That's why I'm here.
I was here for diplomacy, not mass murder.
Not exactly.
That's fine, but diplomacy isn't what I need.
Your assignment took you to the prison's lower levels, where all of the old tech was uncovered. You bagged more than a few Esh-kha, too, correct?
None of it was part of the assignment, but yes, that's correct.
Affirmative.
If you're looking for people with experience down there, look no further.
That's what I do.
You catch on fast.
Quite an interesting career you have, Captain. And I understand you've added "exploring ancient technology" and "gunning down Esh-kha" to your list of skills.
The dangers of the lower levels are familiar to us all.
We all faced those dangers.
The Esh-kha are not mindless beasts, agent.
You make them sound like game.
I'm well aware of that.
You don't survive the lower levels unless you can handle Esh-kha.
Not much choice in the matter.
That's what we're banking on.
It's a competitive market. Gotta find ways to stand out.
That's right.
You caught our attention.
You've obviously done your research. But what is it that you want?
What's this all about?
We need assistance, and your expertise puts you at the top of our list.
You're well informed.
When we look to bring in help, we do our research first.
Four hours ago, the crew of a frigate in high orbit was attacked by Esh-kha warriors who appeared out of thin air.
The crew didn't stand a chance. Captain had to scuttle the ship to keep the blasted freaks from using it to escape. No survivors.
How many people were aboard?
That's awful.
Four hundred and seventy-two. But that's just the beginning.
The Esh-kha must have used the teleporters, from the lower levels.
They used teleporters.
Exactly. Only explanation.
So what?
So what?
You know the tech the Esh-kha used, from down in the deep prisons. Teleportation.
Before the breakout, nobody even knew teleportation was possible. The Esh-kha are way ahead of us. Going to get real ugly unless you help stop them.
We can't let the Esh-kha escape.
Of course.
Agreed.
I guess I could help.
Nice attitude.
My techs think the teleporters are controlled from some kind of hub, deep in the prisons. The Esh-kha must have found their way in and taken over.
One of my people, Agent Poz, will help you find a teleporter to take you in there. And once you're in, you'll push the Esh-kha out.
It'd be wise to have our ships pull back until the task is complete.
Stay cautious until then.
Maybe. We're still not even sure what the range is on the blasted things.
Perhaps we can uncover more about these ancient technologies as well.
A good chance to learn.
Can't hurt.
Any infantry support for this op? Or is it just us?
What are our assets?
Support will be very limited. We've got more on the way, but we can't wait.
I'm sure this will all go just as smoothly as you say....
I doubt it will be so easy.
Depends on if you're as good as they say.
Watch and learn.
I can't wait.
Whatever it takes.
You'll find Agent Poz at these coordinates. Time's against us, so move fast. Good hunting.
Leave me out. [Refuse quest]
Leave me out. [Refuse quest]
Unbelievable. Fine, get lost so I can find someone who actually has a conscience.
Keep moving. Nothing to see here.
